title: The Financial Toxicity of Universal GLP-1 Receptor Agonists in Overweight or Obese Adults With Diabetes: MEPS 2022 Cross-sectional Analysis
text:
— CONSORT FLOW DIAGRAM DATA (2022 Cross-sectional Persons) —
STEP 1: Total MEPS Population (2022) | N = 22,431
Exclusion 1: Pediatric < 18 | n = 4,330
STEP 2: Adult Population (Age >= 18) | N = 18,101 (80.7%)
Exclusion 2: No Confirmed Diabetes Diagnosis (DIABDX_M18 != 1) | n = 15,573 (86.0%)
STEP 3: Adults With Diabetes (DIABDX_M18 == 1) | N = 2,528 (14.0%)
Exclusion 3: Does Not Meet Overweight/Obesity Criteria (ADBMI42 < 27 and no CCSR END009) | n = 1,323 (52.3%)
STEP 4: Eligible Overweight/Obese Adults With Diabetes (ADBMI42 >= 27 or CCSR END009) | N = 1,205 (47.7%)
Exclusion 4: No GLP-1RA Therapy Exclusion (Universal Sample Retained) | n = 0
STEP 5: Broad Overweight/Obesity + Diabetes Cohort | N = 1,205 (100.0%)
Exclusion 5: Uninsured/Other | n = 66 (5.5%)
STEP 6: Final Analytic Cohort (Valid Insurance) | N = 1,139 (94.5%)

Notes: Data derived from the Medical Expenditure Panel Survey (MEPS) 2022 cross-sectional file. Values represent weighted national estimates for overweight or obese adults with diabetes (DIABDX_M18 == 1 and [ADBMI42 >= 27 or CCSR END009]). GLP-1RA indicates glucagon-like peptide-1 receptor agonist. Income categories are based on the Federal Poverty Level (FPL).

Notes: MEPS 2022 cross-sectional estimates. Values represent mean annual out-of-pocket (OOP) expenditures. Costs are reported in nominal 2022 dollars. Confidence intervals (95%) were calculated using bootstrap-estimated standard errors (2000 replicates) and log-transformation to account for the right-skewed distribution of health care costs.

Notes: MEPS 2022 cross-sectional estimates. Financial toxicity is defined as annual out-of-pocket health care expenditures (including premiums) exceeding 20% of post-subsistence income (income remaining after food, clothing, transportation, shelter, and other necessities). ‘Universal GLP-1 Receptor Agonist Adherence’ assumes 100% adherence to incretin mimetic therapy. ‘Inflation Reduction Act Implementation’ applies a $2,000 annual pharmacy cap to the Medicare Part D portion. CIs calculated using Korn-Graubard beta intervals based on bootstrap standard errors (2000 replicates). ‘–’ = Suppressed due to statistical unreliability (insufficient sample size or variance instability).

Notes: MEPS 2022 cross-sectional estimates. Economic Number Needed to Harm indicates the number of patients prescribed universal incretin mimetic (GLP-1 receptor agonist) therapy to cause one new case of financial toxicity. Economic Number Needed to Treat indicates the number of patients in the universal incretin mimetic cohort benefiting from the IRA cap to prevent one case of financial toxicity. ‘Negl.’ = Negligible risk difference (<0.5%).

Notes: MEPS 2022 cross-sectional estimates. Survey-weighted annualized GLP-1RA out-of-pocket distributions are shown as median, IQR, and 10th-90th percentile range by insurance type. Baseline GLP-1RA General Adult Population = all MEPS adults (age >=18) currently using GLP-1RA with observed daily costs (broad donor pool). Baseline GLP-1RA Overweight or Obese Adults With Diabetes Cohort = observed current GLP-1RA users within the final insured analytic cohort of overweight or obese adults with diabetes prior to PMM. Universal GLP-1 Receptor Agonist Overweight or Obese Adults With Diabetes Cohort = final insured overweight or obese adults with diabetes cohort after universal-use assignment, combining observed and PMM-imputed GLP-1RA daily costs.

Notes: MEPS 2022 cross-sectional estimates apply specifically to the Medicare beneficiary population. Values are Mean (95% CI). Costs are reported in nominal 2022 dollars. CIs for costs use bootstrap standard errors with log-transformation; CIs for proportions use Korn-Graubard beta intervals. ‘–’ = Suppressed due to statistical unreliability (insufficient sample size or variance instability).
